Journal_Entry_Line_Data.description: The company for the line for intercompany journals.If field is left blank, it will default to the same company as the header company. For non-intercompany journals this field should be left blank or have the same value as the header company.  For beginning balance journal loads, this field should always be blank or the same as the header company. For journals that are intercompany beginning balances, the other company should only be referenced as an intercompany affiliate worktag.

Journal_Entry_Line_Data.description: Alternate Ledger Account (ALA) provides the ability, when Alternate Account Set is enabled for the header company,  to override the account to which the Ledger Account is mapped by the Alternate Account Set Mapping rules.I.E. - if the Ledger Account is 1000 Cash, and the mapping rules map the journal to the 1100 Alternate Cash account, setting the ALA to 1200: Other Cash Account will cause the journal to use Other Cash rather than Alternate Cash.

validation.validation: Alternate Ledger Account: [ala] is not a member of [company]'s Primary or Alternate Account Sets.

validation.validation: The Currency Rate cannot be negative.
If the base currency is equal to the transaction currency, the currency rate cannot be entered.

Journal_Entry_Line_Data.description: Ledger Debit Amount

validation.validation: If the base currency and the transaction currency are equal, the transaction amount must equal the ledger amount.
validation.description: If the base currency and the transaction currency are equal, the transaction amount must equal the ledger amount.

validation.validation: Decimal precision of [precision] for [currency] exceeded for Debit Amount: [amount]
validation.description: The Debit Amount precision cannot exceed the precision of the Company currency.

validation.validation: If the base currency is not equal to the transaction currency, the ledger amount must also be entered.
validation.description: If the base currency is not equal to the transaction currency, the ledger amount must also be entered.

validation.validation: Ledger Debit Amount must be blank or zero when Round Ledger Amounts is specified.
validation.description: Ledger Debit Amount must be blank or zero when Round Ledger Amounts is specified.

validation.validation: If the base currency and the transaction currency are equal, the transaction amount must equal the ledger amount.

validation.validation: If the base currency is not equal to the transaction currency, the ledger amount must also be entered.

Journal_Entry_Line_Data.description: Reference to existing worktags. Worktags are a way to mark tasks and business objects to make them easier to access and summarize.  Each transaction can include one value for each worktag type and is subject to configurable validation when submitted for approval.

validation.validation: The intercompany affiliate [worktag] may not be chosen when specifying header company [header company] and line company [line company].
validation.description: You have chosen an invalid combination of header company, line company, and intercompany affiliate.

validation.validation: Select a balancing worktag for Worktags of the following type: [type]
validation.description: A balancing worktag is required if worktag balancing has been enabled for the tenant.

validation.validation: Only one worktag of each type is allowed
validation.description: Only one worktag of each type is allowed

validation.validation: One and only one Spend Category worktag or Pay Component worktag needed when using a Grant worktag.
validation.description: One and only one Spend Category worktag or Pay Component worktag needed when using a Grant worktag.

validation.description: You must have Worktag Balancing enabled in order to define a Worktag Balancing Affiliate.

validation.validation: Enter an Interworktag Affiliate that is the type [tenant type].
validation.description: The Interworktag Affiliate Type must be of the same type as defined for Balancing Worktags at the tenant level.

validation.validation: The Balancing Worktag in the Worktags field is not allowed to be the same as the Interworktag Affiliate.
When an Intercompany Affiliate is present in the Worktags field you are not allowed to have a Interworktag Affiliate.

Journal_Entry_Line_Data.description: For expense report and supplier invoice transactions tied to a capital project worktag, Workday creates special accounting to appropriately debit the Work in Progress account, while also recording the amount as a debit into the Spend account.  This is necessary to reflect correct amounts for the purposes of Budget Checking/Reporting, and any other custom spend reports.

CustomerObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

CustomerObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

CustomerObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Journal_Line_Tax_Detail_Data.description: The reference id value for the customer.
The name of the customer or supplier if not defined within Workday.
The address for the customer or supplier if not defined within Workday.
The tax id for the customer or supplier if not defined within Workday.

Taxable_Event_Line_Reference.description: Enter the line order of the journal line to which this tax line is related. Workday uses the line order to relate the tax line to the taxable event journal line
